contextId.information: Here "inheritance" stands for the region that Esau's descendants, the nation of Edom, occupied. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: his inheritance

contextId.information: Here "dung on your faces" stands for disgrace. AT: "I will most certainly put you in deep disgrace; it will be as bad as if I had spread dung on your faces" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: and I will spread dung on your faces

contextId.information: Here the intended results of the covenant are spoken of as if they were the covenant itself. AT: "The purpose of my covenant with Levi was for the priests to live in prosperity and peace" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: My covenant with him was life and peace

contextId.information: Here walking stands for living, conducting one's life in a certain way. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: He walked with me

contextId.information: Here persuading people to stop sinning is spoken of as if it were turning them away from sin. AT: "he persuaded many people to stop sinning" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: he turned many away from sin

contextId.information: Here knowledge is spoken of as if it were an object that a priest could keep. In this passage, the idea of "keep knowledge" implies communicating true knowledge about God.  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: For a priest's lips should keep knowledge

contextId.information: The right way to behave is spoken of as if it were the right path to follow, and abandoning right conduct is spoken of as if it were turning away from that path. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: you have turned away from the true path

contextId.information: This spatial idea stands for the people's awareness of the priests' evil behavior. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: before all the people

contextId.information: Here "ways" stands for "desires" and "behavior." These ways are spoken of as if they were things that could be kept by people. AT: "followed my desires in how you should live" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: kept my ways

contextId.information: Here the habit of favoring some people more than others is spoken of as if it were a thing that could be shown to others. AT: "made people aware that you favor some people more than others (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: shown partiality

contextId.information: Here a witness to an agreement between two people is thought of as standing between them in order to testify about what they agreed to, in case a dispute arises between the two people. This sentence also was meant to remind the people that Yahweh would punish any Israelite who broke the covenant of marriage. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
contextId.quote: a witness between you and the wife of your youth

contextId.information: Yahweh is spoken of as if human behavior could make him tired, but God cannot grow weary in a physical or emotional sense. This statement probably means that Yahweh has become offended or exasperated. AT: "You have offended Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: You have wearied Yahweh

contextId.information: Here getting people ready to welcome Yahweh is spoken of as if a road were being cleared for Yahweh to travel on. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: he will prepare the way before me

contextId.information: Here standing represents resisting someone's attack or accusations. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: be able to stand

contextId.information: Here "sons" refers to descendants. The male descendants of Levi were the priests and workers in the temple. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: the sons of Levi

contextId.information: Disobeying God's ordinances is spoken of as if it were turning away from them. AT: "You have disobeyed my ordinances ever since the days of your ancestors" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: From the days of your fathers you have turned aside from my ordinances and have not kept them

contextId.information: Here "strong" stands for "harsh" or "terrible." And "Your words" stands for "What you have said." AT: "What you have said about me is terrible" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: Your words against me have been strong

contextId.information: Here "walk mournfully" stands for "behave in a sorrowful manner," probably in order to indicate sorrow over their sins. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: walked mournfully before Yahweh of hosts

contextId.information: Here to be called "blessed" stands for being blessed. AT: "we say that the arrogant are blessed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: we call the arrogant blessed

contextId.information: The disaster occurring at this time is spoken of as if the day itself were burning. God's judgment is often spoken of as if it were a fire. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: the day is coming, burning like a furnace

contextId.information: These people are spoken of as if they will become dried-up plants fit only for being burned. It is common for the Bible to speak of people as if they were plants or trees. AT: "all the arrogant and all the evildoers will burn up like dry plants"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: all the arrogant and all the evildoers will become stubble

contextId.information: It was common in the Ancient Near East to speak of the sun as if it had wings, with which it moved across the sky. Possible meanings are 1) the sun's life-giving rays of light are spoken of as if they were its wings or 2) the wings are said to cover God's people so as to give them peace and safey. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: wings

contextId.information: Here the victory of God's people is spoken of as if they were walking over the burned bodies of their enemies. (See:  [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: you will trample down the wicked, for they will be ashes under the soles of your feet

contextId.information: Here the occurrence of this day is spoken of as if it were coming. AT: "before the great and fearful day of Yahweh happens" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: the coming of the great and fearful day of Yahweh

contextId.information: Here changing how people think is spoken of as if it were turning their hearts. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: He will turn the heart of the fathers to the children, and the heart of the children to their fathers
